metadata.feature_description: Allows users to browse, search, and filter files including images, documents, and other file types within the portal.

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Assets and open the Assets panel
steps.expected: Assets panel opens showing file browser with folders and files
steps.actual: Assets panel opened successfully showing Home folder with Badges, Images, Templates, Users folders and several files

steps.action: Enter 'logo' in the Search Files textbox and press Enter
steps.expected: Search results display files matching the keyword 'logo'
steps.actual: Search results displayed cavalier-logo.png with 'logo' highlighted in the filename. Breadcrumb shows 'Search logo'

steps.action: Click on the Images folder to navigate into it
steps.expected: Browser navigates into the Images folder showing only images
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Images folder. Breadcrumb shows 'Home > Images'. Multiple image files displayed with thumbnails (cavalier-tv.png, CTA-1.jpg through CTA-8.jpg, etc.)

steps.action: Click on the folder picker dropdown and select 'Templates' folder
steps.expected: Folder picker opens showing folder tree, selecting Templates navigates to that folder
steps.actual: Folder picker opened showing searchable folder tree with Site Root and subfolders. Selected Templates folder and navigated to it showing Default.page.template file

steps.action: Click on Home in breadcrumb to go back to root folder
steps.actual: Successfully navigated back to Home folder via breadcrumb. All folders and files displayed correctly

steps.action: Verify folder picker dropdown shows hierarchical folder tree
steps.expected: Folder picker shows expandable tree with all subfolders
steps.actual: Folder picker dropdown displayed with search box, expandable Site Root containing Badges, Images, Templates, Users folders, and '5 Results' count

steps.action: Navigate to Users folder which is empty
steps.actual: Users folder displayed 'This Folder is Empty' message with helpful text 'Use the tools above to add an asset or create a folder' and document icon illustration

steps.action: Hover over cavalier-logo.png file and click edit button
steps.expected: File details panel opens showing file information and preview
steps.actual: File details panel opened with tabs (Details, Versioning), file metadata (Created: 2/9/2026, Type: png, Size: 2.0 KB, Last Modified), Subscribe toggle, URL link, and editable fields (Name, Description, Title, Tags). File attributes section with Archive, Hidden, Read-Only, System toggles. Thumbnail preview visible.

steps.action: Verify file action buttons are visible on hover
steps.expected: Action buttons (edit, move, copy, download, delete) appear on file hover
steps.actual: Action buttons appeared on file card: pencil/edit icon, move icon, copy icon, download icon, and trash/delete icon

steps.expected: Search results display files matching the pattern with wildcard
steps.actual: Search successfully found all 8 CTA image files (CTA-1.jpg through CTA-8.jpg). Breadcrumb shows 'Search CTA-*'. Wildcard search functionality works correctly with special character '*'

steps.action: Verify default sort order is Alphabetical
steps.expected: Files and folders sorted alphabetically (Badges, Images, Templates, Users...)
steps.actual: Files displayed in alphabetical order: Badges, Images, Templates, Users folders followed by files in alphabetical order

steps.action: Click on sort dropdown and select 'Last Modified'
steps.expected: Sort dropdown opens showing options: Last Modified, Date Uploaded, Alphabetical. Selecting Last Modified reorders files
steps.actual: Sort dropdown opened with three options. Selected 'Last Modified' and files reordered - now showing Templates, Users, Images, Badges (different order than alphabetical), confirming sort functionality works

observations: File thumbnails are dynamically generated and displayed correctly for image files (PNG, JPG)
XML and CSS files display appropriate code/document icons instead of thumbnails
The file browser supports drag-and-drop file upload functionality (observed in code review, not tested)

FileBrowserController API supports separate endpoints for GetImages, GetDocuments, and GetFiles to filter by file type - however no UI was found to access these filtered views directly. The filtering is done by navigating to folders containing specific file types.
Search uses throttling (400ms delay) and requires minimum 3 characters to trigger search
Add Folder and Add Asset buttons are visible in the UI header for file management operations
